The burden<S>4853</S> of the desert<S>4057</S> of the sea<S>3220</S>. As whirlwinds<S>5492</S> in the south<S>5045</S> pass<S>2498</S> through; so it cometh<S>935</S> from the desert<S>4057</S>, from a terrible<S>3372</S> land<S>776</S>.
A grievous<S>7186</S> vision<S>2380</S> is declared<S>5046</S> unto me; the treacherous dealer<S>898</S> dealeth treacherously<S>898</S>, and the spoiler<S>7703</S> spoileth<S>7703</S>. Go up<S>5927</S>, O Elam<S>5867</S>: besiege<S>6696</S>, O Media<S>4074</S>; all the sighing<S>585</S> thereof have I made to cease<S>7673</S>. <sup>grievous: Heb. hard</sup>
Therefore are my loins<S>4975</S> filled<S>4390</S> with pain<S>2479</S>: pangs<S>6735</S> have taken hold<S>270</S> upon me, as the pangs<S>6735</S> of a woman that travaileth<S>3205</S>: I was bowed down<S>5753</S> at the hearing<S>8085</S> of it; I was dismayed<S>926</S> at the seeing<S>7200</S> of it.
My heart<S>3824</S> panted<S>8582</S>, fearfulness<S>6427</S> affrighted<S>1204</S> me: the night<S>5399</S> of my pleasure<S>2837</S> hath he turned<S>7760</S> into fear<S>2731</S> unto me. <sup>heart: or, mind wandered</sup> <sup>turned: Heb. put</sup>
Prepare<S>6186</S> the table<S>7979</S>, watch<S>6822</S> in the watchtower<S>6844</S>, eat<S>398</S>, drink<S>8354</S>: arise<S>6965</S>, ye princes<S>8269</S>, and anoint<S>4886</S> the shield<S>4043</S>.
For thus hath the Lord<S>136</S> said<S>559</S> unto me, Go<S>3212</S>, set<S>5975</S> a watchman<S>6822</S>, let him declare<S>5046</S> what he seeth<S>7200</S>.
And he saw<S>7200</S> a chariot<S>7393</S> with a couple<S>6776</S> of horsemen<S>6571</S>, a chariot<S>7393</S> of asses<S>2543</S>, and a chariot<S>7393</S> of camels<S>1581</S>; and he hearkened<S>7181</S> diligently<S>7182</S> with much<S>7227</S> heed<S>7182</S>:
And he cried<S>7121</S>, A lion<S>738</S>: My lord<S>136</S>, I stand<S>5975</S> continually<S>8548</S> upon the watchtower<S>4707</S> in the daytime<S>3119</S>, and I am set<S>5324</S> in my ward<S>4931</S> whole nights<S>3915</S>: <sup>he: or, cried as a lion</sup> <sup>whole: or, every night</sup>
And, behold, here cometh<S>935</S> a chariot<S>7393</S> of men<S>376</S>, with a couple<S>6776</S> of horsemen<S>6571</S>. And he answered<S>6030</S> and said<S>559</S>, Babylon<S>894</S> is fallen<S>5307</S>, is fallen<S>5307</S>; and all the graven images<S>6456</S> of her gods<S>430</S> he hath broken<S>7665</S> unto the ground<S>776</S>.
O my threshing<S>4098</S>, and the corn<S>1121</S> of my floor<S>1637</S>: that which I have heard<S>8085</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> of hosts<S>6635</S>, the God<S>430</S> of Israel<S>3478</S>, have I declared<S>5046</S> unto you. <sup>corn: Heb. son</sup>
The burden<S>4853</S> of Dumah<S>1746</S>. He calleth<S>7121</S> to me out of Seir<S>8165</S>, Watchman<S>8104</S>, what of the night<S>3915</S>? Watchman<S>8104</S>, what of the night<S>3915</S>?
The watchman<S>8104</S> said<S>559</S>, The morning<S>1242</S> cometh<S>857</S>, and also the night<S>3915</S>: if ye will enquire<S>1158</S>, enquire<S>1158</S> ye: return<S>7725</S>, come<S>857</S>.
The burden<S>4853</S> upon Arabia<S>6152</S>. In the forest<S>3293</S> in Arabia<S>6152</S> shall ye lodge<S>3885</S>, O ye travelling companies<S>736</S> of Dedanim<S>1720</S>.
The inhabitants<S>3427</S> of the land<S>776</S> of Tema<S>8485</S> brought<S>857</S> water<S>4325</S> to him<S>7125</S> that was thirsty<S>6771</S>, they prevented<S>6923</S> with their bread<S>3899</S> him that fled<S>5074</S>. <sup>brought: or, bring ye</sup>
For they fled<S>5074</S> from<S>6440</S> the swords<S>2719</S>, from<S>6440</S> the drawn<S>5203</S> sword<S>2719</S>, and from<S>6440</S> the bent<S>1869</S> bow<S>7198</S>, and from<S>6440</S> the grievousness<S>3514</S> of war<S>4421</S>. <sup>from the swords: or, for fear, etc: Heb. from the face, etc</sup>
For thus hath the Lord<S>136</S> said<S>559</S> unto me, Within a year<S>8141</S>, according to the years<S>8141</S> of an hireling<S>7916</S>, and all the glory<S>3519</S> of Kedar<S>6938</S> shall fail<S>3615</S>:
And the residue<S>7605</S> of the number<S>4557</S> of archers<S>7198</S>, the mighty men<S>1368</S> of the children<S>1121</S> of Kedar<S>6938</S>, shall be diminished<S>4591</S>: for the LORD<S>3068</S> God<S>430</S> of Israel<S>3478</S> hath spoken<S>1696</S> it. <sup>archers: Heb. bows</sup>
